name: Jordan Crook
text:
I have been thinking for a while about how to even put into words how amazing the whole staff of Seiler skin is-- they are so kind and inviting from the moment you walk into the door to the time you leave (even though you'll want to stay longer). :)  Dr. Seiler and Leigh Anne Gelinas have been working with me since the end of June, and I am so honored/excited to continue receiving treatment from them!
During my initial consultation with the two of them, they were attentive and empathetic with all of the skin/body issues that have been bothering me for years-- specifically my hormonal acne. Side note: they don't just focus on skin-- they also made amazing recommendations for me in regard to my chronic migraines! I have been so discouraged after trying countless "solutions", programs, and even visiting other doctors/experts that have literally said "there's really not much else you can do for hormonal acne." Dr. Seiler and Leigh Ann have so much great knowledge, and I was so comforted and encouraged to hear their recommendations and plan of treatment. In fact, I almost burst into tears when Dr. Seiler said, "We are going to get this handled for you."
After ONE WEEK of being on the new skincare regimen they suggested for me (which, by the way, is incredibly simple and takes about 1-2 minutes), my skin was noticeably clearer (insane, right?!). I am still in shock by how much my skin has improved in such a short amount of time. For the first time in forever, I am much more confident in my skin and can actually go without concealer if I want to! Also, Leigh Ann is SO fun and easy to talk to, and I always look forward to my appointments with her. Being a graduate college student, finances are somewhat tight. However, they have an amazing VIP program full of so many discounts and perks (never seen anything like it before), and they also understood where I was coming from and provided cost-effective options. If you're on the fence about making an appointment with them, know that IT IS WORTH IT. I could go on and on about how much I love this place, and I want everyone to experience what I have with them.

resp.text: Jordan, this is absolutely amazing! We are SO happy you are loving your skin! Thank you so much for such wonderful feedback on your experience with our staff, Dr. Seiler and Leigh Ann. It is a pleasure to have you as our patient and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: T Hill
text: I recently visited Seiler Skin after a very undesirable experience at another skin care practice in Birmingham. My visit to Seiler was fabulous from the time I was greeted until I left. Every staff member is friendly, knowledgeable and goes above and beyond to ensure comfort and clearly puts the client's needs first. Dr. Seiler was truly amazing! He provided options clearly and fully explained what he would do for the most favorable outcome. I'm looking forward to a long relationship with the staff at Seiler Skin!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing this wonderful feedback! We are so happy to hear how much you've enjoyed your experience at our office! We are excited to have you as our patient!

name: Bre Carr
text:
I recently visited Seiler Skin for a consultation and my experience was great. Prior to my appointment I did thorough research on appropriate and research based laser treatment options for African American skin. This is very important to me when determining the best route of treatment and having a doctor who is culturally competent.

I am currently working with Dr. Seiler to reduce the appearance of burn scars I obtained during childhood on the back of both of my legs, scars that I have been self conscious about for over 25 years.

He and his staff were extremely personable and welcoming. I felt very comfortable and human (if that makes sense)  I honestly felt that he is just as committed to my treatment as I am. He was very thorough during our consultation and  reassuring by creating an individualized treatment plan to help me achieve the best and most realistic results possible.

I am super excited and looking forward to working with Dr. Seiler as we navigate my treatment over the next few months.

resp.text: Bre, thank you so much for this wonderful feedback! I read it to our team this morning during our "morning huddle" and it warmed our hearts. We love what we do and can't thank you enough for sharing this feedback with us and others. We are so excited to have you as our patient and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Sarah Banks
text: Nice staff and facility. I believe the services are over priced. I do understand you “get what you pay for” but there are also situations where paying the absolute most for something doesn’t mean it works any better. Highest priced Botox in the area from my experience and also a $65 “Botox service” charge for the doctor to administer. Main issue is the high prices, additional service charges and the constant attempt to up sell.

resp.text: Hi Sarah, we are so sorry to read this. We always strive for our patients care and experience to be the very best. Please feel free to contact us at your convenience to discuss your concerns. 205-870-0204

name: Christine Blakley
text: I had botox plus some lamp probe around my nose for broken capillaries. First, let me just say that Dr. Seiler has a gentle touch with botox! It was pain-free, and he kept me talking and comfortable the entire time. The lamp probe procedure was quick but had a kick - but nothing I couldn't tolerate and the little red veins are already almost gone in less than 24 hours. Very worth it! I'm going to go back in late summer for a vampire facial. I am so impressed by Dr. Seiler, his staff, and how knowledgeable and friendly everyone is in the office. This is my new place - and I'll recommend it to everyone who wants to look and feel their best. (I'll add that for my initial consultation, he spent almost a half an hour talking to me, making suggestions, and answering questions. I've never had a consultation that comprehensive and it made me feel like choosing Seiler Skin was the right choice!)

resp.text: Hi Christine, thank you for this wonderful feedback! So awesome to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with Dr. Seiler and our staff as well as your results!! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Rebecca ledbetter
text:
I chose Dr. Seiler after experiencing several years of unsatisfactory results from procedures I had received from another practice.  I was searching for an environment in which concerns about my skin and questions about treatments were answered honestly based on a thorough consultation specific to my needs. I wanted to be given realistic expectations rather than "before and after" pictures and stories of previous patients results.
I had become accustomed to this type of communication from my previous physician and as a result, after spending thousands of dollars,
I was rarely, if ever, satisfied.
As a patient, one needs to feel listened to, and cared for not only by the Doctor, but the staff as well.  So far Seiler Skin has checked all my boxes in meeting these expectations.
Results from scheduled procedures will occur in the next few weeks, but I don't think I have been given a sales pitch nor have I felt pressured into doing anything that I'm unsure of.
For the first time I feel as if I'm working with someone who has my best interests at the forefront and that is how it should be.

resp.text: Rebecca, thank you so much for this wonderful feedback! It means so much to us and it’s truly our pleasure to have you as our patient. We are so excited about your treatment plan! Thank you for putting your trust in us. Can’t wait to see you at your next visit!

resp.text: Baylee! Thank you so much for this amazing feedback! We LOVE having you as our patient! It's truly a pleasure.

name: Kate K.
text: Tension Headaches completely gone!!! I get Botox injected in my neck and jaw to get rid of my headaches and it's worked so much better than I could ever hope. About a year ago I was getting headaches almost daily because of my terrible and completely uncontrollable habit of clenching my jaw while I slept. I was also feeling pretty insecure about my face, my weight hadn't changed but my face always looked so puffy. Turns out my jaw muscles were just massive. After my initial injection with Botox (which was pretty much painless) it took about three weeks before I started to notice I wasn't waking up with headaches. After 3 months my face started to slim out. After about a year my face finally looked like my old face again (my cheekbones look so good)! The lines in my neck have also become a lot less noticable. Dr. Seiler is absolutely incredible, I can not recommend him and his team enough!

resp.text: Kate, this makes us so happy!! We are so glad you've found relief from your headaches and are happy with your results! We appreciate your feedback so much! Looking forward to seeing you at your next visit!

text: Price for Botox was listed on website as $13 per unit and that is what was discussed in consult. I was charged double the units on the day I was there (30 instead of 15 units). The representative who called back refunded the 15 units, but then insisted there was a $65 injection fee on top of the price per unit. They eventually refunded $30 of the $65 injection fee, but I’m not sure I’ve ever felt so unsure of what I just paid for.

I would really appreciate if doctor seiler see this review and understand what kinda people that working for him and drive people like me away😔😔😔😔😔

text: I highly recommend this skin doctor!!! We were treated so well here, me and my husband had the pleasure of meeting with the dr and his wife , they took time with us and explained everything to us and the staff is amazing!! I feel so much better and I cant wait till my next appt coming up !!!

resp.text: Jackie, it was such a pleasure to meet you and your husband! We are so excited to have you as our patient. Thank you so much for such a kind review! See you soon!

text: I love Seiler Skin! Dr. Seiler and the entire staff is wonderful!! I’ve been a patient for 9 years. On every visit, I have been given the best care you can imagine. I highly recommend you visit if you are reading this!

name: Lauren Sisler
text: I have now been visiting Dr. Seiler for over two years. From my first consultation until now, he and his staff have always gone above and beyond to answer all of my questions and provide the best treatment available. He has never recommended something that is unnecessary and pays very close attention to detail. His staff is always very knowledgable about all the services and products offered and can help in making an educated decision about whether it's a procedure that suits your needs and fits into your budget. I highly recommend Dr. Seiler and his services and believe he has one the best Skin and Cosmetic clinics in the state Alabama.

name: Ryan Stringer
text: I had a great first experience meeting with Dr. Seiler and Jill! They took their time with me and addressed all of my concerns to achieving better skin!

resp.text:
Hi Ryan, I’m so sorry you’ve had trouble getting in touch with us. We’ve had some issues with our phone system. Please email me your phone number and I will call you directly. What is the best time to reach you tomorrow? Again I’m so very sorry you’ve had this experience. My personal email is jill@seilerskin.com
Jill Seiler

name: Greg McMullin
text:
I am an amputee and was seeking Botox injections to reduce sweating in my prosthetic while running. Even though this is not Dr Seiler’s normal range of practice, he and his staff have gone out of their way in order to help me, even going as far as to contact other doctors to ensure that the approach he is taking will be the most effective treatment plan for me. This kind of interest and extra effort is rare these days.
Big thanks to Dr Seiler and his staff for going the extra mile!!

resp.text: Greg, thank you for such a kind review of our practice! It's truly our pleasure.

name: Emily Shepherd
text: From the moment you walk in the door, every member of Dr Seiler’s staff is so welcoming, knowledgeable, and professional. I had a chemical peel with Adina yesterday, and she took the time to educate me throughout the entire process so I’d know exactly what to expect. I’ve also had laser treatment with Dr Seiler in the past, and couldn’t be happier with the results. No one knows skin care as well as Dr Seiler and his staff, and they take such wonderful care of their patients! I can’t recommend them enough.

name: Donna Catlin
text: I just had a vampire facial and love the results. I’ve been going there for years and love the whole experience every time.

resp.text: Hi Donna! We are so happy to hear you are loving the results from your Vampire Facial. It's one of our absolute favorites! It's truly our pleasure to have you as our patient. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Paul Baaahziinga
text:
As a patient as well as a physician, I appreciate the incredibly professional and knowledgeable care given by Dr. Seiler and his staff. If you compare similar local providers, their websites are less up to date and less informative. Not only does the site show the details of their advanced and new equipment, but it also shows how Dr. Seiler provides individual attention and care to the patients. He makes you feel valued and important as an individual, as well as providing very personalized care himself!! I've recommended Dr. Seiler to friends and loved ones; I highly recommend the Seiler Skin Cosmetic Laser & Aesthetics Center to you!!

Paul A. Bohnen, MD

UPDATE: I transferred this review which I originally wrote for the Seiler Skin website to share it amongst Google users.  A year after my previous review, my results are still terrific!  Very pleased...and I highly recommend Dr. Seiler and staff!  Thanks again!

text: I went to this office a while back and it was a total mess. Disorganized, unprofessional and expensive. All they did was force expensive products on me. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

resp.text:
Hi Jenine,
We take matters of patient dissatisfaction very seriously. Upon receiving your review, we immediately checked our records to identify you so we could reach out to discuss your experience. However, we do not have any records of you as a patient under this name. Regardless, we are committed to upholding superior standards of patient care. Please contact us at 205.870.0204, as we are eager to discuss the issues detailed in your review.

name: S. Mabrey
text: Just had a wonderful HydraFacial with Katie. After an informative consult with Dr. Seiler—who was super cool, patient, and helpful—we decided on the HydraFacial treatment with an IPL laser treatment in the coming weeks. Would definitely recommend this unconventional type of facial. Katie used a tiny, yet very powerful vacuum to suck out all the gucky stuff (I was skeptical but it actually works), and what’s left, she gently extracts. She applied lots of amazing creams and serums to hydrate throughout, which my skin DRANK. Katie is a sweetheart and knows how to make you feel relaxed, comfy, and gorgeous. Can’t wait to go back for my IPL!

resp.text: Sunny, we are so happy you enjoyed your experience with Katie and Dr. Seiler! It is a pleasure to have you as our patient. We look forward to seeing you at your next appointment. Happy Holidays!

text:
I have been a patient at Alabama Dermatology for over 20 years. I have seen several doctors over the years. I can only say good things about every one of them. The front office is always clean & orderly. The staff have always been friendly & professional.

Today was my 1st visit with CRNP, Alicia Holloway. I was greeted by Mrs. Holloway with a smile. She took the time to answer all my questions. Mrs. Holloway was very professional yet made me feel comfortable.

She didn’t push products or services in a way that made me feel like just a number. She made suggestions based on my concerns. I’m not sure how long she has been with the practice but I believe she is a great addition.  I will be back to see her & will definitely refer friends and family.

text: I will definitely be going here for any future checkups. They are very professional, knowledgeable and friendly. I saw a few bad reviews but they did not match the experience I had at all. Nothing but good things to say!

name: Susan Chambers
text: Average wait is an hour and a half. Receptionist is Extraordinarily rude. Always rude. She shouldn't engage with the public. Of course, the dermatology clinic is the only game in town so I can't imagine the clinic cares one twit. One nurse was spectacularly rude and slammed the door in my and son's face after reluctantly dragging us to light therapy (for which we waited an hour to get in). The clinic is overwhelmed, badly managed and appointment times so far out that patient just gives up or dies. The One positive part of this place is Dr. Walker and her nurse, Michele. They are both  beautiful, inside and out, caring, professional and know their stuff. I pray Dr. Walker and Michelle would split off from the clinic and form their own practice. I know a lot of people who would follow them in a heartbeat. I'm sorry I'm so rude but customers should know.

text: Every person working this morning was very kind and professional.  My appoint was 9:15 am and my wait was less than 20 min... I don't see what everyone was complaining about in the other postings. I had no issues and no complaints. Well done employees, Dr Lucas and her nurse.

name: Ginger Bailey
text: Such a well run office! Dr.Walsh and her staff are amazing! I was concerned about the removal of my SCC so close to my eye, Dr. Walsh was extremely maticulous and thorough!!! Very compassionate group of people, thanks for such a pleasant experience!!!

name: Taylor Stephens
text: There are a lot of bad reviews on here, but my experience was excellent. First off, there is a major shortage in dermatology offices in Tuscaloosa which is why it takes so long to get an appointment and it's always backed up when you go. Its not an individual business issue; it's a market issue. That said, this business has handled high volume pretty well from my experience. Everyone from the employees in the front to the doctor that saw me were helpful and pleasant. I hope if you are making a decision on where to go, that you take this office into consideration.

name: Edward Todd
text: Attentive and caring staff, and Dr. Weeks was wonderful. Patiently listened to all I had to say and answered all my questions. Not rushed at all.

name: Forrest Wright
text: I came here a few years ago and saw a nurse practitioner named Emily Watson for eczema. I had heard that some types of food can cause eczema, so I asked her if this was true, using acidic foods as an example. She told me there was no way my eczema could be caused by a food and said that when black people have eczema it’s white and looks like acid on their skin so that’s probably where I heard this. I’m shocked and appalled that a medical professional would think that was an appropriate thing to say to a patient. She prescribed steroid creams that cost hundreds of dollars, even with insurance. Turns out my eczema was caused by dairy. How is it possible that someone could be so ignorant? You’d be better off driving to Birmingham and spending your money on a real dermatologist.

name: Ally Cox
text: Terrible. Waited an hour and 20 minutes was never called back. I got my money back and walked out. They don't care and don't think your time is valuable. The lady at the front told me there was no where else for me to go. Would not recommend

text: Did not appreciate to be told , "we're not taking new patients." I'm sure majority of the patients do not have to come back year after year for small issues such as mines and I think they need to find out what the issue is first. No one cares to be turned around when they're  in need of finding  someone to help them.

name: Kirk Walter
text: I had an appointment to see Dr. Lucas at 9:30 this morning - at 10:15 I still had not been called back to an examination room.  While this type of disrespect might be excusable for other types of doctors, those that must respond to patient emergencies, this is not the case for dermatologists.  A wait like this is only understood in the context of poor office management.  If this practice cares so little for their patients' time, I'd hate to guess how much they care about their health.

name: Gary Rogers
text: I was scheduled to see Staci Hardwick, CRNP.  After waiting over an hour, she comes into the patient room and makes a light hearted apology for being behind schedule.  I made a statement asking if this was normal procedure being behind.  She said most often yes it was.  I told her that was a shabby way to run a business because it seems like they are always an hour or more behind schedule.  Ms. Hardwick told me that if I didn't like the fact she ran behind because she was taking care of patients with worse needs than mine (I was there for a follow-up to a Blue Light treatment) that I should find a new dermatologist.  I told her that she was right.  I got up put on my coat and left.  I absolutely do not want this woman to practice medicine on me when she has this kind of attitude.  She needs to learn proper family care methods.

Edited from a 1 star to a 5 star

I’ve changed my negative review to a positive one after receiving a phone call from the owner of this practice. I understand why these “no show” policies have to be in place as I work in the healthcare field as well.  After talking to the owner I would recommend this business.

text:
Dr. Youhn had the nerve and audacity to tell me that I should wean my son. Last I checked, breastfeeding is outside her scope of practice and she has no business giving professional advice about childcare or breastfeeding to a patient. It is unethical to give advice or direction on any topic professionally outside one’s scope. Breastfeeding and the health and wellness of my son most definitely are.

Updated because they decided to be unprofessional with their response here and on Facebook.

These comments started when I was asked if he was my only one and if I was thinking about having more yet and I said I'm still not sleeping so no. She kept saying should really talk to his ped because he doesn't need to be nursing all night long. At his size he doesn't need to eat at night and he's probably just doing it out of comfort. I didn't ask for sleep advice.
I mean I could understand her saying the nursing could be irritating my issue and that weaning might be something to consider.
But talking about how my son doesn't need to nurse anymore and I should really just talk to his pediatrician about weaning him is way beyond her scope and none of her damn business!
His pediatrician has no problem with it and nursing till 2 is recommended by the WHO.

text: In response to Dr. Hartman's reply to my review, I appreciate your telephone call. However, as I communicated to you in our conversation last night which you neglected to include in your response, I have waited for a return call to my non-urgent issue way longer than 24-48 hours. My first follow-up appointment where the biopsy was taken was on June 13th, where I was told by a clinician that I would know the results before I left for vacation. I called for results initially 1 or 2 days before I left town June 23rd. I then called back on the 28th, where I was told once again that I would be called back before close of business, yet I was not. I was never informed by any of your staff that I spoke with (both clinical and non-clinical - I have spoken with both) of the 10-14 day timeframe for biopsy results. In speaking with you last night is the first I have heard of the 10-14 day waiting period for results and the results not being discussed until the scheduled follow-up visit. Perhaps some form of training refresher would be useful in ensuring that all of the staff, both clinical and non-clinical are relaying uniform information and setting the proper expectations to the patients. Once again, I appreciate your reaching out to me and I am sorry that I had a less than desirable experience.

name: Cassandra Harris
text: I had vein surgery and everything went well, but the time that they give you to recuperate isn't good.  They say you can go back to work or they give you 1 week to recuperate, and you have to ice and heating pad, how can that be effective when, how is it possible to do that at work. I think the down time should be as long as you have to wear the compression hoses.  Walking can be done at home.  Also dis-appointed that the compression hose can't be purchased throw the office with insurance, because insurance does pay for it...

resp.text:
I'm pleased you were happy with your procedure, however, I'm disappointed you were dissatisfied with the other aspects you mentioned.  Customarily post procedure, most everyone returns to work and daily activities the very next day or two at the latest.  We understand not everyone recovers the same, additional time to to feel back to normal may be warranted.  We would have been more than happy to extend your time off with a work excuse...not a problem at all.  If you experience post procedure discomfort, you are welcome to try heat or ice to the area that is bothering you.  Yes, this would be difficult while at work, this is intended to be done while resting at home.  Compression hose is to be worn for 2 weeks following the ablation procedure.  We want you to resume walking and regular day to day activities within the next day or two at the latest while wearing the compression hose, just not strenuous exercise or running for 2 weeks.  This will aid in your recovery and prevent post procedure swelling plus minimize the risk even further for blood clots.  We don't want you to sit around not moving for 2 weeks, that will only prolong the recovery process.   Compression hose is covered by only 1 of the 50+ insurance companies that we accept....and only on a case by case basis with that one carrier....after we submit your medical records for review by the insurance investigator.  The majority of the time this charge is denied.  We charge the patient for the compression hose up front, if insurance happens to reimburse us for the hose, we will refund the purchase price to the patient immediately.  Unfortunately, this happens only 3-4 times a year.  Some patients attempt to recover the charge on their own by submitting the charge....they are sometimes successful, however, it is only with the one insurance company.  I promise you will receive a reimbursement for the hose if we receive a reimbursement from the insurance company.  Again, I'm terribly sorry you are disappointed.....we would be delighted to meet with you in the office to discuss your concerns.  I appreciate you taking the time to review us....we strive to be a dedicated center of excellence.  Reviews help us improve our patient care and office policy. If we can be of further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at 205.823.0151 or to me directly at the info below.  Have a great day.

Zeke Eldridge
Practice Administrator
zeke@alabamaveincenter.com
direct: 205.716.6050

Christina Hunt and Dr. Hunt work together on this and I have complete confidence in both of them.
I think the biggest step for me was Microblading my brows. It’s made a real difference in my appearance.  Christina is a true artist and a kind and supportive professional. She makes suggestions, knows what we don’t, and her work is beautiful.
Most of my life, I didn’t have resources or time to pay attention to my skin.  Now that I’m 72 years old and Christina has been working with me the last four years, my skin is much improved.  No matter what your age or skin problems, Christina can make it better!

My cuts were not in line.  I was cut on skin instead of along the clean lines of the nostril.  My nose inside looks like he was drunk when he did my surgery.

The outcome was not what I expected at all.  He did not make my nose look natural at all.  I am actually wondering what was Dr. Bentley thinking when he was doing the work.  My finished product looked nothing like the image that l was given.

The lady Kristin who answers the phone can be very rude and abrasive.

text:
After a total hysterectomy a nurse friend of mine, who also uses HHWL, recommended HHWL.  She told me I was way too young to experience all that menopause had to offer so I called and made an appointment.  That was 3+ years ago and I have never looked back!

I cannot imagine my life without hormones, and neither could my husband.  Living without hormones would be like needing glasses to be able to see but not wearing them.  Why would I do that?

I feel like I got my life back but without the fears and dangers with the pharmaceutical route, which I knew was never an option for me.  I am now a competitive bodybuilder and have the energy to train.  I am also a personal trainer and have recommended hormone replacement to many of my clients.

I have loved working with the staff and they are completely knowledgeable and very accommodating to any concerns or questions I have had along the way.  It has been an amazing experience and I plan on being on hormones the rest of my life.

text: No matter what your skin issue, Dr. Ginsburg and his amazing team are eager to listen to you to find a resolution that fits your needs and budget. I had my procedure in April  I'm in shock at already how amazing I look. I have the jaw line I've always dreamed of! Dr. Ginsburg has personally called and checked on me 4 times since my procedure and I've never had such a personable experience from a doctor! He  doesn't know it but he has changed my life!

name: Pat Hamilton McMurrey
text:
In around 1996-97, I had liposuction at Ginsburg Dermatology Ctr. The first time I went, I spend around $3500 for Dr G to remove a very small patch of stubborn belly fat. That went well, or at least I thought so. The next year I went back and got him to remove excess fat around my ankles, knees and "love handles", another $3000 and then several trips to have saline injections in varicose veins.  I was pretty pleased with the results. Now, after a little over 20 years, I have a Huge hernia on my belly which 2 surgeons have assured me my insurance will not pay to fix because it is caused by previous damage to my stomach muscles that has allowed my stomach to sag through but not my intestines! Also, I have horrible huge purplish red areas around my ankles which my current dermatologist has assured me is lipodermatosclerosis. It is inflammation in the under-skin layer of fat. Not much to do about that either.
I am really unhappy to have spent nearly $7000 only to have my body RUINED in the long run!!! Be very careful about what you have done and ALWAYS get a second opinion.

name: Jeanette Cosby
text: Great people

name: Eleanor Rose Godfrey-Burnick
text:
I've been using Dr. G for about 9 years now. Each and every time I walk out, I feel as it's 1) been done right the first time, and 2) he know what he's doing, always!

About a month or so ago, I found something on my face, that I knew didn't belong there. Last week, Dr. G. cut off and biopsied it. The following day I got a phone call saying it wound up being a Squamous  Cell Carcinoma. After doing a slew of research (probably something one shouldn't do on their own) Dr. G said, 'Calm down, and don't worry. If you gotta get one, that's the one you want!'

So, yesterday morning Dr. G completed the procedure using what he called the 'Mohs Procedure' of removing it. Thankfully, he got all of it the first time. Talk about relief...

24 hours later, one wouldn't know I had anything done, other than the band aid (across the underside of my nose) a bit of swelling and now it's starting to turn black and blue.

Trust me, if you need something dermatological, Botox/Fillers injections, etc., he's your guy! I promise you, he won't do anything you don't need done!

And, he's the absolute best!!

name: M Gray
text: I could not be more pleased with my lipo experience performed by Dr Ginsberg!!  He and Julie make an amazing team!  Their professionalism and wonderful bedside manner made this experience totally worth while.  I am seriously wondering what took me so long to pull the trigger and go forward with the procedure.  I had done my research and after two kids and a few stubborn areas I was finally ready to go for it after my consultation.  I went in for my consult last Wednesday and scheduled my procedure for this morning.  I asked lots of questions to have a better understanding of what to expect. Julie forewarned me about the feeling of bee stings to provide the numbing solution and for me, it actually was not bad at all! Everyone will have a different experience and pain tolerance varies of course but after the numbing solution was put in at one point while Dr Ginsberg was working on my sides I was LITERALLY laughing!! I had absolutely no discomfort during the procedure nor afterwards.  Julie has an amazing voice- the conversation was wonderful and all in all I keep asking myself ‘what took me so long!’  I was able to drive myself home and am currently experiencing no discomfort 5hours post procedure- just staying on a towel to absorb the drainage!  Thank Dr Ginsberg for making this a memorable experience in the best way! Looking forward to the swelling going down and seeing the results after a while. If you are on the fence- this is your guy!  Go for it!  You will be glad you did!!

text:
I am 40+ fit & active with stubborn fat areas despite diet and exercise after 2 pregnancies. Dr Ginsburg performed 360 Smart Lipo on my abs and flanks 11/28/18, his down to earth personality and singing nurse Julie put me at ease during the procedure which although totally numb locally I was fully awake. We laughed a lot and I didn’t mind the procedure one bit. Dr G called me personally that night to check on me and Candace was awesome at answering any post care questions and addressing any of my concerns as I healed. Nurse Julie and the Dr were willing to call if I needed but Candace is so knowledgeable it’s likely unecassary.

This was a life changing procedure for me as no matter how much I exercised or how much weight I lost, that ugly c-shelf and love handles were always there. Now it’s totally gone and my silhouette is lovely as it was pre- pregnancy...over 25 years before my first child! Dr G told me what my outcome would be according to his experience and expertise. My significant other witnessed the procedure, the healing process, and now the joy of me loving my midsection again. I am snatched!!!

Listen, you can trust Dr Ginsburg and his staff. He is the best available so if you’re debating and searching then look no further. Trust him to reshape you and then follow post surgery instructions. I have 2 more areas of concern and he has proven himself to be my choice again.

name: Jo Dee Musselman
text:
Dr. Kirk Jackson has been our family’s primary physician for fifteen years and consistently has provided kind and professional care..  He is a fine and perceptive diagnostician truly listening to his patients as they explain their symptoms.  His ability to do so is important because time and medicines are not wasted.
If a patient needs a referral to a specialist, he matches the patient to that physician ensuring a productive outcome..
Dr. Jackson truly cares about the life circumstances of each patient which is vitally important because the patient will be more compliant with the treatment plan.  A patient wants to be “heard” by an unjudgemental health team.  The sraff is chosen carefully and reflects the values of his practice.
We feel fortunate to have this fine doctor and his staff to expeditiously respond to our medical need  and, at the same time, leaving us with the warm feeling that “cure” has been accompanied by sincere “care”.

The receptionist was obviously stressed or too busy to spend over 30 seconds on the phone. When I asked her to repeat what time she said she yelled it out.  After that I asked when the Nurse would be available in Janurary, her response was, "Ok, just what time do you need." I felt like she was too quick and sarcastic to answer a simple question. As a health care provider myself, I treat ever patient with respect they deserve no matter how busy or far behind I am and I depend on the office employees to ensure every patient is taken care of and treated correctly. name: Emily Daleo
text: I received a certificate for a massage for Christmas and decided to go ahead and schedule the massage. They made the appointment for 3:00 on a Friday. On Wednesday, they called to tell me that they had double booked my appointment, and ask me to come in at a different time on Friday. I was not able to come in at that time, so I had them schedule an appointment for the next Friday at 3:00. When I walked into the spa, I was told that I was not on the schedule. They don't send confirmations of your appointment, and they don't call to remind you of your appointment. Apparently, they really just have trouble booking your appointment at all. Not exactly the kind of experience I want from a spa, and I won't be trying to reschedule again.

resp.text: This was an unfortunate event that we took very seriously. We issued a complete refund of the gift certificate and offered a free 90 minute massage. All clients who are on our schedule receive either a text message or phone call the day before their appointment. We take pride in giving the very best customer service.

name: Elizabeth Bailey Matson
text: I went to have a trial of my hair and make up and it took 2 hrs for my hair alone and I was not happy with the outcome. I had scheduled to have my hair and make up done, but they had to rush the make up and would have cancelled the trial if I hadn't persisted that I wanted to see the whole picture before my wedding. They hadn't booked enough time from the beginning. I wanted natural looking makeup, but it is caked on and not flattering. I went here after I saw all the positive reviews, but I did not have a positive experience! I'm so glad I tried before my wedding day as the whole thing stressed me out and it's not even the big day!

resp.text: At Ambiance it's our goal to make every Bride feel and look beautiful on her wedding day! During the consultation we strive to find the best hair and make up style with the client for her Big Day. The trial run is very important to us and sometimes it takes longer than anticipated because we want the client to be happy. Therefore, we offer a second complementary trial run! We regret you were not satisfied and we hope you will come back for your complementary trial run to perfect your look.

name: Marina Schroeder
text: I went in for a wax, the facility gives an outward appearance of being very clean and calming, and the employees are all very pleasant, however they double dip the wax! By this I mean they put the same stick that they've put on your body back into the wax (which is not hot enough to kill bacteria that resides on your skin), and unless they change the wax every time a new customer comes in (unlikely, and very expensive), you're getting everyone else's microorganisms on your body, yuck! Not only is this extremely unhygienic and disgusting, it's also illegal. Will not be returning here.

resp.text: Here at Ambiance Spalon we are committed to offering you the cleanest experience in town. We sanitize every room and every utensil after every service. Double dipping is a No No! When you come to Ambiance we guarantee a safe environment for all our customers.

Every time she would do my hair when I would get home my husband would always say your hair looks nice. When she was No longer doing my hair it looked nice but I never got the compliments that I use to get when Laura Beth was doing my hair. Every time I would go get my hair done I would think I sure wish Laura Beth was still doing my hair i missed her. My husband started looking for a new job and we found out we were moving to Newnan,Ga. I started thinking, I wonder how far she is from where I was moving to. I got on Mapquest and it was 76 miles. I didn't care, it was worth every mile I drove for her to be doing my hair again. Ambiance is a very nice place and everyone there is very friendly. I met the owners that day and they are really nice. You won't regret going to Ambiance and getting Laura Beth to do your hair. Best decision I ever made to drive 76 miles to get my hair done. name: Shawn Reaves
text:
WORST SPA EXPERIENCE OR LACK THEREOF THAT I HAVE EVER HAD!!!

I made an appointment for a brazilian wax Friday morning because they had a great web special going for $39, upon which I specifically asked the owner did they do guys and was it ok. The owner said not a problem and let the receptionist make the appointment for Tuesday of the following week. On Monday I get a call around noon and informed they do not do guys and that she was "sorry"....Why did she make the appointment in the first place?

Now I tried to call around Auburn but no one has any appointments open for the the next day on such short notice. Now their policy is to deduct half the price of your service if you give them less than 24 hours notice, yet what do I get when they give me less than 24 hours notice....nothing!!! The point is I counted on them to provide a service that they said they would and now Im left having to travel out of town possible to get waxed.

A word of advice to Ambiance Spalon...if your going to advertise you might want to say no guys or girls only on your ad so in the future this doesnt happen!! And how about reimbursing me for the extra money I had to pay someone else for waxing because I relied on your business.
